definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: They were tearing down that old building in order to build a new apartment house there.
sentences.chinese: 他們在把那座舊樓拆掉，好在這裏蓋一座新的住宅樓。

sentences.english: The death toll of a big fire that engulfed a high-rise building in downtown Shanghai had risen to 53 by 9:20 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，上海市中區的一棟住宅樓被大火吞沒。

sentences.english: Differential settlement and wall cracking occured at two resident buildings of Xiantan University.
sentences.chinese: 湘潭大學有兩棟住宅樓發生不均勻沉降及牆體開裂。

sentences.english: To government cadres residential against the building, it is late.
sentences.chinese: 至機關幹部住宅樓前，天已晚。

sentences.english: A huge fire has destroyed a high-rise apartment building in Shanghai, killing at least 42 people.
sentences.chinese: 上海一座高層住宅樓發生火災，造成至少42人死亡。

sentences.english: This design of resident buildings is becoming / getting fashionable.
sentences.chinese: 這種住宅樓的設計正在逐漸流行起來。

sentences.english: Above the retail are lower residential towers and detached condos.
sentences.chinese: 在商業街上方是低層的住宅樓和獨棟公寓。

sentences.english: DWG Duplex multi-residential building construction plans 06…
sentences.chinese: 多層複式住宅樓施工圖06。

sentences.english: Square Founder residential building, it is common really.
sentences.chinese: 方方正正的住宅樓，實在是司空見慣。

sentences.english: Building a full set of small high-rise residential building construction plans.
sentences.chinese: 小高層住宅樓建築全套施工圖。

sentences.english: Each 3-story townhouse has space for a private garden and views from an upper deck.
sentences.chinese: 每3層的住宅樓在頂端有觀景的私人花園。

sentences.english: The invention is a kind of multi-floor variable compound building.
sentences.chinese: 多層面可變式複合住宅樓涉及建築領域。

definition: top floor/the top of a building
Gundam, Japanese animation franchise/Jean-Luc Godard (1930-), French-Swiss film director
tenement building, typically of 2-4 stories, with a shop on the ground floor and upper floors used for residential purposes (esp. in southern China)
to quote a price/seller's first offer
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
